text: Life After Life is a 1975 book written by psychiatrist Raymond Moody. The book presents the author's account of what it is like to die.Clifton D. Bryant (2003). Handbook of Death and Dying Sage, p.138.Michael Marsh. Review: Beyond Death: The Rebirth of Immortality The Hastings Center Report, Vol. 7, No. 5 (Oct., 1977), pp. 40-42. Life After Life sold more than 13 million copiesTowards the light The Age, March 23, 2004. and became an international best seller which made the subject of near death experiences popular, and opened the way for many other studies.Harvey J. Irwin, Caroline Watt (2007). An introduction to parapsychology McFarland, p. 158.Duane S. Crowther (2005). Life Everlasting Cedar Fort, p. 19. Moody wrote a second book, Reflections on Life After Life, in 1977.Lee Worth Bailey and Jenny L. Yates (1996).
